dialogues.text: What about my medicine? Medicaid gonna cut me off. How am I supposed to get my medicine?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mamma, I'll send you more money!

dialogues.speaker: MARDELL
dialogues.text: Hope you don't expect J.D. to move in here with us. He's gettin' out, you know.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just give me the money, why did you have to buy a house?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Didn't have to, Mamma. But it's yours. You want the money, sell it. And Maggie walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie carries Mardell's boy up and puts him down on the porch, tussles his hair before turning away.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: I know you didn't mean nothin' hurtful by this. Sometimes you just don't think things through.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: That's true, Mamma.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: I'll try to keep the house, I just worry about all those expenses.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I'll send you some more money. Earline touches the bruise on Maggie's face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: Phat man hittin’ you?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It's from the fight. I'm a fighter, mamma .

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: (with compassion) Find a man, Mary M. Live proper. People hear ‘bout what you're doing and they laugh. Hurts me to tell you, but they laugh at you. off Maggie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie fills the tank. He looks up from the pump, sees Maggie sitting in the passenger seat, staring out the win trying not to feel or think and failing at both. Somethin makes her look at the old pickup at the other pump. A scrawny girl, maybe ten, sits in the pick up stroking t old hound dog beside her. Her father returns, handing her string of red licorice, before leaning across to pull her door shut. The girl smiles at Maggie before they drive of Frankie gets back into the rental, sees Maggie smiling.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You ever own a dog?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Nope. Close as I ever came was a middleweight from Barstow. He starts the car and they pull out.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: My daddy had a German Shepard, Axel. Axel’s hindquarters were so bad he had to drag himself room to room by his front legs. Me and Mardell'd bust up watchin' him scoot cross the kitchen floor. Daddy was so sick by then, he couldn’t hardly stand himself, but one morning he got up, carried Axel to his rig and the two ef them went off into the woods, singing and howling. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wasn't till he got home alone that night that I saw the shovel in the truck. (beat) Sure miss watchin' the two of them together. They drive past the shacks set in the cedars and oaks.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got nobody but you, Frankie.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE,
dialogues.text: Yeah, you got me, Till we find you a manager. And she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Can you stop just up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booths are so worn that one would think General Lee dropped off here for a coffee on the way to Gettysburg. A piece of lemon pie sits in front of Frankie. He puts a forkful in his mouth and his expression tells us everythi

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: I could die a happy man right now.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I used to come here with Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: PRANKIE
dialogues.text: Is this place for sale? Cause I have some savings. Maggie watches him eat, every bite an explosion of pleasu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, looks out at the gym. Sees DANGER hunched ov the ice chest, closely inspecting a bottle of frozen wate Serap appears in the doorway with a bucket and mop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is Danger looking at? Scrap turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Appears to be another bottle of water. Scrap starts on his way again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Hey. Going to Vegas, wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Seen you suffer over a nickel slot. My heart can't take that kinda pounding anymore.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: She got her title fight. Blue Bear. Million dollars, whacked down the middle. +

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: That's real good. Real good. PRANKIE. Could use a good second. Can't find one; thought I'd ask you.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: ...Why the hell would I want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Because, you're a half-blind old fool who never got there yourself and I thought you'd like to see what it felt like to be in the ring at a title match. 'Scuse me for feeling sorry for ya. Frankie didn't mean this to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Naw, you pick up somebody in Vegas. Somebody with young hands.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Oh, don't start crying; I already got one girl. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggis /2003 gi.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: I leave this place for one day, you got any idea what it'll look like when I get back?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Lot like it does right now?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Appreciate the offer.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: -Fine. Frankie heads out.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: You tell Maggie not to come back here without no belt. Frankie nods, walks out. Scrap watches him go. SCRAP V.O. The rule was don't run from the pain, step into it. But there's another rule: when something's over it's over. Scrap sees Danger next to him, the frozen water in his ha

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: Mist Scrap? I got a question, but I feel stupid askin' it.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a stupid question, Danger. Danger looks at the bottle, tries to formulate the though SCRAP V.O. Course, soon as you make a rule, someone's there to break it.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: How'd you get the ice in here through this little tiny hole? I been thinkin! on it, can't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: ...Why don't I show you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggis/2003 82.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: You can do that? You can show me?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Believe I can. As they walk into the back...

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: And I was thinkin’ I might be ready for a fight.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: You de, do ya?

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Oh, © don't know, you're comin’ along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited, Maggie finishes packing as Frankie enters.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Got the tickets, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: So, wetre flying?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE,
dialogues.text: You want to drive?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: ...You're asking me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: I'm asking. You want to fly or drive?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: So, I finally get to decide something?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Fine. Fly there, drive back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: That's the stupidest thing I ever heard. How the hell we gonna do that?!

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You said it was up to me. She heads out with her suitcase. Frankie follows, knowing Clearly there's a good reason he doesn't train women. SCRAP V.0. There's no real way to know what'd happen if you did one thing and not the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danger works himself into a sweat. SCRAP V.O. Maybe you'd still just end up in the wrong place at the wrong time. Sorap passes Shawrelle coming out of the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWRELLE
dialogues.text: Toilet overflowin'. Scrap tosses him a disgusted look and exits to get his bu Shawrelle looks around.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DRESSING ROOM 110
dialogues.text: The place is flooded, Scrap steps right into it.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Jesus-H-Mother-of-God. Scrap jams his hand down the back of the tank, pulls up t lever, stops the flow, and reacts to what we don't see.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stupid old man, coulda been sittin' in The Mirage having a MaiTai and watchin' naked girls. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SINK
dialogues.text: Scrap empties a bucket of filthy water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: iis Haggis/2003 84.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: Scrap flushes the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: He mops up the last of it. Stops as he hears shouting fro the gym. He drops the mop and strides toward the door, co out to see:

dialogues.speaker: DANGER AND SHAWRELLE
dialogues.text: in the ring at the far side of the gym, Shawrelle giving Danger a terrible beating.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Serap springs out of the hall, but his first step is bad a patch of unmopped water. Scrap goes sprawling. Shawrelle doubles up his punches as Scrap scrambles for t ring. Danger's other eye bursts open, but Shawrelle can't knock him down. Scrap careens off the fighters standing, stunned, around ving. He lunges through the ropes and slams Shawrelle in the chest, shoving him to the far corner. Serap cradles Danger's swollen head in his hands -- his e staring back like a dumb animal, so sick he's ready to di bloody slobber spilling from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHTERS
dialogues.text: Standing around come to life again; some giving Shawrelle ugly stares, others just walking off, one touching Danger shoulder as Scrap lowers him to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: How'd I do, Mist Scrap?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: You done great, Danger, you my man, you a rock, Shawrelle taunts from the ring. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggis/2003 85.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWRELLE
dialogues.text: Flippy, you can't be done. You ain't thrown a punch. Scrap stays focused on Danger.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Anybody can lose one fight. You come back from this, be the next champion of the world. Danger offers a tiny smile through his bloody teeth.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: No, I won't, Mist Scrap. TI shoulda knowed. Scrap can't look in his eyes. He reaches for Danger's glo

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Here, baby, let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: I can do her, just untie the knots. Serap does and Danger manages to tug them off.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWRELLE
dialogues.text: Don't take your gloves off, Danger. You ain't even used em yet.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: {to Danger) I borrow these for a minute? Scrap pulls on Danger's old gloves and climbs into the ri Shawrelle laughs at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWRELLE
dialogues.text: Oh, look, I get to fight a retard and an old man. And that's the last word out of his mouth, as Scrap nails him with a jab that could stun an elephant. But Shawrelle isn't going down that easy. He slams Scrap on the side of his head, same side as his bad eye. Scrap staggers but he doesn't go down. Shawrelle tries the same shot but Scrap slips the punch, rotates into a half crouch and hits Shaw with a left hook to the liver. Shawrelle dances back. Scrap stalks him. Shawrelle throws a powerful combination. Scrap blocks and keeps coming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 210 lil 112 Haggis/2003 86. CONTINUED: (3) i210 Shawrelle charges. Scrap steps aside, hits him with anoth left hook to the liver, then an uppercut to the jaw that snaps Shawrelle's head and puts the bey down and out. Scrap stands over Shawrelle, pulls off his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: One hundred and ten. He rolis him over with his toe, sees Shawrelle swimming t consciousness. Spits-

dialogues.text: Get a job, punk. Shawrelle spits out a red tooth. Scrap looks to:

dialogues.text: Danger isn't there.

dialogues.text: Scrap steps out onto the sidewalk, looks up and down the empty street. Danger is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's coiled in her rebe, looking down the mouth of th corridor into the arena, where we hear the announcer and murmur of the crowd. Frankie stands beside her, along wit a SECOND they picked up here im town. From the arena we hear a lone FAN shout out:

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FAN
dialogues.text: Ma-cush-la! Maggie locks to Frankie with the question.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Win this, I'll tell you what it means. An ASSISTANT DIRECTOR cues them. Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way, I got you some pipers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And they walk down the tunnel to the sound of BAGPIPES... the pipers lead her in.

dialogues.text: Scrap sits on the edge of his cot watching TV, icing his swollen fist, as they pipe Maggie into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --the WBA Welterweight champion of the world, Billie The Blue Bear Astrakhov! The Bear drops her electric blue robe, pulls off her Russ fur hat, revealing a polished, shaved head. She flexes he massive arms.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus.

dialogues.text: Maggie, in pale green, looks iridescent under the colored lights. She stands in her corner serious and hard. Franki steps in close to her face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Box her. Stick that jab into her big tits till they turn blue and fall off. Maggie nods. The bell rings, the Bear charges, throwing a right-lead haymaker. Maggie slips under and, stepping to her left, drills the Bear with a right to the gut, hitting the sweat spot of t solar plexus, and the Bear goes down gasping for air. The crowd leaps to it's feet, the cheers deafening.

dialogues.speaker: FANS
dialogues.text: Ma-cush-la! But at the count of eight the Bear gets up smiling and co after Maggie, throwing punch after punch. Maggie bobs and weaves like mercury lapping in a dish.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND
dialogues.text: (in awe of Maggie) Lock at the way she moves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 114 115 Haggis /2003 88. CONTINUED: Li4

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIB
dialogues.text: Yeah. Frankie smiles, proud.

dialogues.text: Maggie hurts the Bear with a combination. The Bear grabs her. The ref separates them. The Bear swings quickly, bar grazing Maggie.

dialogues.text: A few fighters gather around a radio, listening te the fi

dialogues.text: grabs for the stool, Frankie snatches it.

dialogues.text: Always hear your voice, boss.

dialogues.text: Her manager talks to her. The Bear just stares at Maggie.

dialogues.text: A group of Irish Fans stand, shouting

dialogues.text: Mo Cuishle!! The bell rings and (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: The challenger darts in, lands a combination to the head and body, another one. And a right hook stuns the champ.

dialogues.text: Scrap inches closer to the edge of the cot

dialogues.text: Billie catches Maggie with an elbow, then tries to jam he palm into Maggie's nose. Misses. The ref pushes them apar Maggie works her from the outside, shooting jabs into Bil chest like she's ramming her with the end of a two by fou The bell sounds. Frankie swings the stool through the rop

dialogues.text: The BELL sounds and Maggie springs out of her corner. The Bear comes out throwing wild. SLAM. Maggie rocks the Bear onto her heels and moves in with a one-two hook that puts Billie on the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: vises as the ref COUNTS.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Stay down, you bitch, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: fy Four, five... The Bear bounces up and grabs Maggie, tries to throw her the mat. The ref is right in there --

dialogues.text: Do that again, it'll cost you a point! Billie ignores him, shoves Maggie again. The ref turns to the scorers table and signals them to...

dialogues.text: Take away a point. And with his back turned he doesn't see the Bear catch Ma with an elbow.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: screams and points as..

dialogues.speaker: A GASH
dialogues.text: opens up over Maggie's left eye. The bell sounds.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: swings in the stool. MAGGIE drops onto it. Her second ope up his kit. Frankie takes over, going to work on the cut.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: It'll be okay. It'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Got no doubt, boss. With a FLASH we're back in...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGHT 122
dialogues.text: Maggie's eye is almost swollen closed. It doesn't stop he from nailing Billie repeatedly, knocking the Bear back in the ropes. But Billie stays up. Head-butts Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: REF
dialogues.text: Two points! You're warned! Maggie takes the fight to Billie again. Billie head-butts her. The ref pushes her back, holds up five fingers and yells. FRANKIE screams over the din. The BELL sounds and Frankie heaves the stool in before it stops ringing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maggie drops onto it. Frankie ices her eye.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Eyes are blurring, boss. Frankie washes her eye.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: How many eyes you need to fight?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: One's enough. Now what I do about the Bear?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: You know how to step outside and go to the liver with a right hook?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Been doin' that. She's made of steel.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: This time don't go to the liver, go to the cheek of her big dyke ass. Stick your fist into her sciatic like a dagger and keep stickin' it.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Won't the ref see that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Not you keep the Bear between you and him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five second warning. FLASH

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: drives her fist into the Bear's right cheek. Billie squaw in pain. The Bear's manager yells. As the ref turns his head Maggie doubles up into the cheek and the Bears leg buckles in pain. FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE 123
dialogues.text: slams punch after punch into the Bear's gut and head as t crowd SCREAMS. FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE 124
dialogues.text: jumps the Russian with combinations that has her head wob and the crowd on its feet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She clobbers Billie with a hook to the jaw and the Russia goes down to one knee. The ref counts as...

dialogues.text: crap holds his breath.

dialogues.text: The Bear rises at nine. Maggie throws another combination turning the Bear's legs to jelly. SCRAP V.O. The ref was about to stop the fight... Maggie's arm cocks for a slam to the head, an open shot. The BELL rings.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...when the bell rang. And we go into excruciating slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more punch woulda put the Bear on the mat. But Maggie caught her punch and pulled it back.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: hefts the stool through the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: sees Frankie, drops her hands and turns to her right.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAR
dialogues.text: rips a punch into Maggie's blind eye. Caught off balance, Maggie stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The late punch scrambled Maggie's inner ear. Her legs buckled. She never been knocked down, and her mind rebelled against the thought. Maggie tries to plant her foot, fails. Frankie looks up, sees Maggie falling toward the stcol. Grabs for it. Maggie tries to twist around to break her fall. Twists too hard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her neck comes down full force on the metal band of the s Silence. Just the sound of a neck breaking. All we hear now is Maggie's breathing. Frankie screams as Maggie slumps to her side on the mat.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP 127
dialogues.text: watches in stunned horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Frankie over her, stretching her flat, the ring doctors running toward her. Sees the ref pushing Billie back. Even Billie seems stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: exhales. Her eyes blink. But the next breath doesn't come Her eyes close. BLACK. Silence. Then she BREATHES and we HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's right, breathe for me. FADE UP to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's being carried on a stretcher as a PARAMEDIC works t ambu-bag covering her face.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Good girl, breathe! Through fluttering eyes she glimpses Frankie above her, then slips back into unconsciousness. BLACK. We hear the sound of a VENTILATOR and FADE UP:

dialogues.speaker: LAS VEGAS GENERAL HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: DOCTORS work over her, talking in mumbled voices...BLACK. FADE UP.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE 131
dialogues.text: strokes her hair, a two day growth on his face. He says something reassuring, she can't hear it. BLACK. FADE UP. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: be ww ay 132 133 134 Haggis /2003 94,

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DOCTOR
dialogues.text: shines a light in Maggie's eyes. Asks her something. BLAC PADE UP.

dialogues.text: The camera tilts to a mirror in the corner of the room. I it Maggie sees herself, lying motionless on the bed, hook up to machines, the ventilator breathing for her. And we finally see...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE'S FACE
dialogues.text: taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh, God. She closes her eyes. BLACK. FRANKIE (¥.0.)} How ya doin', darlin‘?

dialogues.text: opens her eyes. Sees Frankie, another three days growth o his face.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You growin' a beard, boss?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Thought it might help with the women.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Can't say it does. And she closes her eyes again, and Frankie strokes her he

dialogues.text: Frankie waits. Scrap sits beside him, a bag in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Brought you some clothes. Forgot to give them to you. How's she doing today? It takes a moment to answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Haggis/2003 95. be ww bs

dialogues.text: She's okay.

dialogues.text: Think they'll let me in to see her?

dialogues.text: Yeah. Told them I was her father. You were her grandfather. Scrap tries out a smile. Two doctors step out of Icu.

dialogues.text: Scrap sits with Maggie. She's still doped up.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Where's Frankie?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Talking to the doctors. No doubt tellin' them how to do their job.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: They're telling him I'm a Cl and C2 complete. Means my spinal cord's so broke they'll never be able to fix it. Gonna be frozen like this the rest of my life. Scrap doesn't know what to say-

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Asked them to tell him. Don't know how he's gonna take it. (beat) You see the fight?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Course I did. You had her cold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I shouldnita dropped my hands. I shouldn'ta turned. Always protect yourself, how many times he tell me that?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: He does like to repeat himself.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Will you tell him I'm real sorry?

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: I'll do no such thing. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrap comes out to find Frankie leaning against the wall. Serap stands there a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Damndest thing, huh? (finally) So, what's the plan? I know you got one, So you might as well tell me. Frankie turns and looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: This is your fault. Her in there Like that. You kept after me till I trained her. I knew I shouldn't. Not a girl. Everything told me not to. 8verything but you. Frankie walks back to Maggie's room. Leaving Scrap destro INT. [Cu -- CONTINUOUS 137 Frankie pulls up a chair, leans close to Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get you outta here. These doctors don't know squat. If they did, they wouldn't be living ina desert. Soon as you can be moved, we're taking you someplace where they actually studied medicine. You just sleep now, okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She nods, closes her eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie opens her eyes to find a nurse and a resident inse a tube in her throat. SCRAP V.O. Maggie couldn't eat right, so they fed her through a stomach tube. Then she got pneumonia, her lungs filled with fluid and had to be pumped out. Maggie closes her eyes. They start the pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes to find Frankie giving her a sponge ba

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: They got nurses for that, you know.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: They're amateurs. SCRAP V.O. She developed skin ulcers because she couldn't change positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie watches from the hall as another nurse and reside voll Maggie on her side. SCRAP V.O. There were biood clots in her legs and problems with hemoglobin. To induce a daily bowel movement, she was placed on her side and pressure was applied to her lower abdomen. We can't see what the resident is doing, but we can assum he's inserting tube in her rectum. Maggie catches Frankie eye. He gives her a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was humiliated every moment of every day. She smiles back for him.  Haggis/2003 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie's on the phone. Hangs up, checks a pad, dials aga SCRAP V.0O. Frankie must have called every hospital in America, looking for somebody who'd tell him they could fix her. Came close twice; till they checked her over, said there was nothing to be done. Frankie hangs up. Walks off down the hall,

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Took two months till she was stable enough to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie lies twisted on -her side. She opens her eyes, see Frankie. :

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: How ya doin’, darlin‘?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Well, you know, they got tubes stickin’ up me in places I'd rather not think about.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Found two good rehab clinics. You want to hear about them? She has something on her mind, but doesn't say it.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: .-Sure.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: There's a real good place in Kansas City, only couple hours from your momma's house. Thought you might like that.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mamma call yet?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: It's hard to get through here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. {beat} Where's the other place?

dialogues.speaker: PRANKIE
dialogues.text: Downtown L.A.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I'd vather go with you, boss.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright, white ambulance cuts a path in the asphalt. SCRAP V.0. They made the six-hour trip by ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie motions for Frankie zo lean closer, so that the attending pulmonologist can't hear her. Frankie does.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Fly there, drive back. And she laughs. And Frankie has to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance disappears into the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stucco building in downtown L.A. Behind the facade lies expanse of landscaped lawn, California sycamores and palm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie watches from the nearest chair as the nurses and resident go through the painstaking procedure of getting Maggie into her special wheelchair. SCRAP V.0. Evergreen was a nice place. They took good care of Maggie. She wouldn't have complained if they hadntt. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of QUICK CUTS: the attendants check the tubes in her bladder, her stomach, and through the front of her ne

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.0., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It took several hours every day to get her ready for the wheelchair. They stretch her arms and legs; lift her into the wheelch strap her in; switch her respirator to the one built into the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since she couldn’t breathe on her own, her respirators were always on. Oxygen was pumped into her twenty~ four hours a day. She turns her head to see Frankie. He gives her a wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's eyes are closed when Frankie enters with a small bunch of daisies. He finds something to put them in, then realizes that she's watching him.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You ever heard of dysreflexia, hoss?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Can't say I have.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It’s somethin' that happens real quick, Like when you get a kink in your pee tube? Gets your heartbeat all to rushin’.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: That happen to you?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Last night.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: (rising) I'll talk to the doctors,

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: No, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 Haggis/2003 . idl.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {chis is hard) Awful as it is when your heart’s fixin' to explode, it made me happy, boss. ‘Cause I thought I'd be free of this mess. I almost made it, too. Then they brought me back to bein' this same old snowman, same old twisted-up snowman wishin‘ to God it was July.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Bh, Jesus, Maggie. I knew I was wrong to train you.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Don’t say that. Don't you ever say that. Workin’ with you was the only time since Daddy passed I had respect. You'd take that away from me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: .No.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: All right then. (beat) We almost did her, too, didn’t we, boss? Huh? Daddy'd a been proud. Frankie squeezes her hand. It takes a moment for him to realize that she can't feel it. The phone beside her bed vings. Frankie picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Maggie's room... dust a second. {to Maggie) It's your brother. Maggie can't stop her face from brightening. Frankie hold the phone next to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: {into phone) d.D.?...When'd you get out?... Is Mamma there?... No, tell her--... Really, it‘s...Okay. Yeah. Bye. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods to Frankie. He hangs up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He says Mamma can't stop crying. {beat} They're coming to see me. Maggie smiles so hard she almost cries. SCRAP V.O. Knowing something ain't likely to change doesn't stop a person from wishing it would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie sits alone in the church. He's never prayed this hard in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie sits in her wheelchair in the visiting room, takin in the sun. There's even a little color in her gaunt face Frankie sits beside her. She's watching the parking lot, cars coming in and out.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIB
dialogues.text: I tell you about when we all got Chicken Pox?

dialogues.speaker: PRANKIE
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Me, Mardell and J.D. Daddy was on a long-haul out to California and Mamma didn't hold with no doctors. But we're all makin' a terrible fuss. So she packs us up and we drive forty- two miles to the Stop and Go in Domain, where Mamma buys us super- size Cherry Slurpees. Tells us that'll fix us up. It doesn't, of course. So, we camp in the parking lot all night, drinking Cherry Slurpees. And damned, if in the morning we don't all feel better. (beat) Mamma mighta changed after daddy passed; but something real wrong, she always knew how to make us feel better. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at the parking lot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You check the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Only been a week, hardly had time to drive here yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie sleeping in her chair, angled to see the parking l Frankie beside her, reading a book. SCRAP V.0. She waited by the window every day for the next two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie is on his phone in the office. SCRAP V.O. And Frankie called their hotel every day. Learned they'd checked in six days earlier. Kept leaving messages, which were never returned. Frankie hangs up, looks to the door, sees SCRAP moving pa Serap looks at him. Frankie goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie wakes to find Frankie reading aloud.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Ach graé fir Gig is é bhreoigh go fol las mé.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin'?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Teaching you Gaelic.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: While I'm sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Heard it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 Haggis/2003

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mo Cuishle in there?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Ain't seen it yet.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You don't have to hang around all day.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: I like it here. If you weren't here I might just come and sit, read a book just cause I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mamma will be here soon, share some of the burden.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Ain't no burden. Say this: ach gra fir Gig. Maggie tries her best.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus that's terrible, try it again. Maggie does.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop-stop, you're killing it. Here's what you're saying. (reads) I will arise and go now, and go to Innisfree, and a small cabin build there, of clay and wattles made. (skips down) And I shall have some peace there, for peace comes dropping slow, Dropping from the veils of the morning to where the cricket sings. A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You gonna build a cabin, boss?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Me? (CONTINUED)
baa ul Ww  153 154 oO a Haggis /2063 1 CONTINUED: (2) is3

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You know, when you quit all this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Never gonna quit. I'd miss the stink.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Think that's true? Cause I could see you there, real easy, with your books and lemon pie.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: ...You wanna go live in a cabin?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I could learn how to bake.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll start looking then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they sit there, smiling at their little shared joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie lies on her side, the DOCTOR examines Maggie's leg it's purple and ulcerated. He drops the sheet back over i

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: We may have to lose it, Maggie. Maggie nods. She doesn't look to Frankie. Who wouldn't know how to put a good spin on this if he tried forever. INT. EVERGREEN REHAB CENTER - CORRIDOR -- DAY i55 Frankie dials the pay phone. Hears a door open at the far end of the hall. Sees: BARLINE, MARDELL AND J.D. enter.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Almost smiles. Till he see Mardell and J.D.'s T-shirts. Universal Studios. Disneyland. A man in a suit follows them down the hall. Frankie meets them half way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 Haggis /2003 106. ur CONTINUED: is

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Frankie Dunn, we met at your house.

dialogues.text: Where's my little girl?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Maybe it'd be a good idea to go back to your hotel and change. She doesn't know you've been here a week visiting Mickey and Daffy. J.D. We've got business with my sister. Just tell us where she is.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Take it you're J.D. {to man in suit) Take it you're the business. {to Earline) Maybe you missed a few rides, maybe you should go back and I'il teil Maggie you couldn't make it.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: I drove all the way here to take care of my child and you're suggesting T’m not a good mother? Mary M can't go nowhere; if we coulda taken her to Disneyland we woulda.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: (to passing nurse) Margaret Fitzgerald?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Down here. Frankie thinks about stopping them. Knows he can't. J.D. bumps Frankie's shoulder in passing. Frankie waits there as they disappear into her room. He walks to the window, knowing whatever's going on in that room isn't going to be good. He goes to the soda machine, deposits some change. Nothing comes out. He kicks it.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Frankie appears with a cup of coffee. The door to Maggie' ward is closed. He walks to where he can see through the floor to ceiling window. Inside: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: be o

dialogues.text: be ut a

dialogues.text: have a good laugh at something.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: paces away. Can't stand to watch them break her heart. Bu he goes back anyway, in time to see:

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: showing her a document, confusion on Maggie's face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: has had enough. He opens the door and steps through. Magg leoks up to him, her face grey.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: How we all doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RARLINE
dialogues.text: Sorry, darlin‘, but we ain't got a letta time. Mr. Johnson's charging us a lot of money tc be here to make sure this is done proper.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Why don't you leave that and I'il read it to her. d.D. You family? You stay out of this.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Read it to me, Mamma.

dialogues.speaker: EARLING
dialogues.text: It's just something legal, to protect your money.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mamma, you don't have to worry, the Boxing Commission's paying for all this. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: But what if they don't, Mary M? Mr. Johnson says they could take my house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ur 6 Haggis/2003 108.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: T£ you assign your assets to your mother, no one will be able to touch chem. J.D. Not doctors, not funeral expenses, nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Fine, so leave it and --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: ~- Mr. Dunn, with respect, this isn't your business. That stops Frankie dead.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll just wait out in the hall. He steps out, leaves the door open.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: You been a good daughter, Mary M. You sign that paper, it'll take care of your family, the way your daddy woulda wanted you to. How do you make your mark? Can you hold a pen?

dialogues.speaker: MARDELL
dialogues.text: She gotta do it with her teeth, mamma. You gotta put it in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: (holding out pen) Here you go, darlin’.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You see the fight, momma?

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: Honey, you know how I feel about that.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I did pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE
dialogues.text: You lost, darlin'. Ain't your fault, way I heard it, but you lost. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EARLINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't wanna lose the rest of what you got left. Barline eases the pen into Maggie's mouth. Maggie bites down on it. Then lets it fail out.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: What happened to you, Mamma?

dialogues.speaker: EBARLINE
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mamma, you take Mardell and J.D. and get home. Before I tell that lawyer there that you were so worried about your welfare you never signed those house papers like you were supposed to. So, amy time I feel like it, I can sell it out from under your fat, lazy hillbilly asses. And if you ever come back, that's exactly what I'll de.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family heads for the hills. Frankie watches them go, then walks into...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE'S ROOM 158
dialogues.text: Maggie is near tears.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Thought somebody should count to ten. Maggie laughs. Frankie awkwardly hugs her, puts her head his shoulder, but she refuses to cry.

dialogues.speaker: PRANKIE 159
dialogues.text: sitting alone in Maggie's ward, her bed gone.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE'S BED 169
dialogues.text: is back. Her leg is missing. She opens her eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: They took my leg, boss. He kisses her head. She closes her eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: It'll be okay. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Always hear your voice, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie opens his door and stops. On the floor lies an envelope, the same size and shape as the others in the shoebox, And he just stands there, staring at it. Broken.

dialogues.speaker: INT, EVERGREEN REHAB CENTER
dialogues.text: The place is dead quiet, save the sound of the night nurs passing in the hall. Maggie opens her eyes to see Frankie sitting there, reading some sort of catalogue. He looks u

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: You need anything?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIS
dialogues.text: Need to know what Mo Cuishle means.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: You didn't win, don't have to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You're the meanest man I ever met, no wonder nobody loves you. You remind me of my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: He musta been a good looking man. Frankie goes back to reading.

dialogues.speaker: GGIE
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna make me talk more Yeats, are you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: These are classes at City College. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: PRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thought I'd buy you one of those wheelchairs you can use by blowin’ into a straw. Thought you might want to go to school.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I got a favor to ask you, boss.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Remember what my daddy did for Axel?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: ..-Don't even say that.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I can't be like this, Frankie. Not after what I done. I seen the world. People chanted my name. Well, not my name, some damn name you gave me, but they were chanting for me. fT was in magazines. You think I ever dreamed that'd happen? (beat) I was born at two pound one and a half ounces. Daddy used to tell me t fought to get into this world and I'd fight my way out. That's all I wanna do, boss. I just don't want te fight you te do it. (beat) Only two péople in this world I ever wanted to be proud of me. You are one. You proud of me, boss?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: You have to ask?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I got what I needed, boss. Got it all, Don't let em keep takin' it away from me. Don't let me lie here till I can't hear those people chanting no more.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: »..-I can't do it. Please, don't ask me.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I am asking.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Tocanit. She nods and turns her head away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings, waking Frankie from a dead sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches it up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Hello?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie hustles down the corridor, met by an intern, who talks as he tries to keep up. SCRAP V.O. In the middle of the night, Maggie'd found her own solution. She bit off her tongue. Frankie fires into the room, shoving aside a male nurse t see Maggie, trying to fight away the doctor by banging he head back and forth. Frankie grabs her head, holds it, lo into her wild eyes as the doctor administers another shot

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nearly bled to death before they stitched her up. She came round and ripped them out before Frankie even got there. He scothes her and let's the shot take hold. Her eyes hal closed and Frankie steps away to let the doctor in to sti

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: As Frankie paces, running his hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They stitched her up again, padded the tongue so she couldn't bite, and gave her a tracheotomy, so she could breathe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: INT, EVERGREEN REHAB CENTER
dialogues.text: Maggie slowly comes out of it. Her eyes find Frankie

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: What'd you do, darlin’? He wipes away the tears that flow down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just gonna keep fighting me, aren't you? She blinks once for yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie walks, stops. Realizes that he is lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie sits on the steps, Father Horvath beside him.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER HORVATH
dialogues.text: You can't do it. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Edo. But she's thick, Father. You have no idea how hard it was to train her. I had to explain every little thing, things any other fighter would dust do without asking, she'd want to know why and how and then she'd do it her way anyway. I got no idea how she ended up fighting for the title--didn't get there by listening to me. (beat) Now, all she wants is to die, and all I want to do is keep her with me. And God forgive me, but it feels like I'm committing a sin by doing it. By keeping her alive, I'm killing her. How do you find your way out of that?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER HORVATH
dialogues.text: You don't. You step aside, Frankie, you leave it with God. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: She's not asking for God's help. She's asking for mine.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER HORVATH
dialogues.text: Frankie, I've seen you at mass almost every day for twenty-three years. Only person who goes to church that much is the kind who can't forgive himself for something. Whatever gains you're carrying, they're nothing compared to this. Forget about God or Heaven and Hell. ff you do this thing, you'll be lost; somewhere so deep, you'll never find yourself again. Frankie knows it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie sits with Maggie as she sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Wetre keeping her sedated so she won't try that again. Frankie nods, watches the nurse leave. Looks at Maggie's eyes fluttering, trying to find him. Lost. He stands, kis her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie takes his cut bag out of the locked drawer, place it on his desk. Takes several bottles of adrenaline from the drawer, places them in the bag along with a syringe. looks up and notices Scrap watching from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: I went in to see Maggie this morning. You musta been somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Frankie locks his drawer.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: You got a fight I don't know about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: ...2t wasn't your fault. I was wrong to say that.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Damn right it wasn't. I found you a fighter, and you made her the best fighter she coulda been.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: I killed her.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: (scoffs) Killed her. That girl walked in here with nothin’ but guts, she had no hope of becoming what she needed to be. A year and a half later, she fought for the championship of the world. People die every day, washing dishes and sweeping floors, and their last thought is that they never got their shot. Cause of you, Maggie got hers. You know how many people in this world get that? (beat) If Maggie died today, I bet her last thought would be, I did pretty good. (beat } I could rest knowing that. Frankie snaps shut his bag but doesn't lift it. A moment. PRANKIE. Yeah. He nods and then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: BXT. EVERGREEN REHAB CENTER
dialogues.text: Frankie sits in his car for an eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the corridor. The night nurse is on rounds, the desk lies empty. He steps into...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE'S ROOM 173
dialogues.text: She opens her a kiss on the hanging there. eyes when she hears him. He smiles, gives her head. He looks her in the eyes, the question She blinks once, he nods. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He reaches into his bag.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: I'm going to put pressure on your neck, it'll cut off your air and put you to sleep, okay? She blinks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then I'm gonna give you a shot...and you'll just stay sleeping. She blinks, offers a small smile. He flicks off the alarm on her monitor, then puts his hand on her throat and look her in the eye. Asks himself again if he can do this. She gives him a smile and blinks once. He leans in close to h ear and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mo Cuishle. It means “my darling, my blood." And she beams. Then blinks and closes her eyes for him. H applies pressure to her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he removes a syringe, loads it up with adrenaline. His ha leaves the shot. SCRAP V.0. He gave her a single shot where they wouldn't see much of a needle mark. It was enough adrenaline to do the job a few times over. He didn't want her going through this again. His hand drops the syringe back in his bag.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: feels for her pulse. Gone. Strokes her hair. Kisses her forehead. Takes his bag and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then he waiked out. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: watches from the shadows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haggis /2003 LL7. 173 CONTINUED: (2) i73

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His eyes as dry as a burning leaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrap sits on the bench. SCRAP V.0. I went back to the gym. Waited, figuring he'd turn up sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 175 INT. HIT PIT -- DAY 17s Scrap sits on the same bench. He looks up, smiles... SCRAP V.0. And that's when a ghost came through the door. The person sits. It's Danger.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: Got to thinking what you said, Mist Scrap.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: What was that, Danger?

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: Anybody can lose one fight.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: And that's the truth. Go put on your gloves, you missed a lot of training.

dialogues.speaker: DANGER
dialogues.text: Sure will, Mist. Scrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrap opens the door, looks in. Frankie's desk lies bare, save a single key lying on the rough leather. SCRAP V.O. Frankie never came back at all.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE GYM
dialogues.text: Danger throws his pitty-pat punches in the direction of t heavy bag. Scrap passes on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP
dialogues.text: Danger, you hit something or I'm gonna toss your ass outta here. Danger is so shocked he actually smacks the bag good and hard. He looks around, stunned and amazed and as pleased hell. And as he throws his arms up in the air and opens h mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serap opens Frankie's front door, pockets the single key. SCRAP V.O. Frankie didn't leave a note.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN 178
dialogues.text: He checks the fridge. Empty. SCRAP V.O. No one knew where he went.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: He opens the closet. The clothes are gone. Ali that's lef are a few shoe-boxes. Curious, Scrap reaches up for one.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hoped he'd gone to find you.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: sits at the single chair and opens the box, removing the letters one at a time. All are unopened. All addressed to Katy Dunn, an address in Indiana. All are marked "return sender".

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ask you one more time to forgive him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning across the pages of a long, hand written letter. We pick out phrases we heard Scrap say... ."Set.in the ce and oak trees, somewhere between nowhere and good-bye"... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: "Boxing ig an unnatural act..." We finally find Scrap's hand, writing the current page. SCRAP V.G. But I don't think he had anything left in his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place looks familiar. It could be that place where Frankie and Maggie stopped. The place with the best lemon pie in the world. SCRAP V.O. I just hope he found someplace where he could find a little peace. With its rough hewn exterior, it looks an awful lot like cabin. Through the windows we think we catch a glimpse of Frankie behind the counter. But we can't be sure, maybe t owner just looked a little like him.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAP V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that's probably wishful thinking. No matter where he is... I thought you should know what kind of man your father really was.

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: the end
